name: 16 Mile Brewing Company
description:
16 Mile Brewing Company, Inc. opened its doors in July 2009 to the public. It is owned and operated by Brett McCrea and Chad Campbell.

The 16 Mile Brewing Company name harkens back to the late 1700’s when Georgetown was still known as Pettijohn’s old field, a rather isolated town, centrally located in Sussex County. The area was “16 miles from anywhere” in the county and was the best place for farmers, merchants, and politicians to meet to conduct official business. Georgetown replaced Lewes as the County Seat when numerous petitions were sent to Delaware’s General Assembly requesting that the move be made to accommodate all county residents. (For more information see “16 Miles from Anywhere: A History of Georgetown, Del., by William J. Wade.)

name: 192 Brewing Company
description: We began building our dream in 2007. We have improved our recipes, gathered feedback, made changes, and sampled our products. We have one concept. We want to Make great beer. Not beer that tastes like a bitter plant, or a leather belt. Not clear beer that has been mass produced and over filtered. Just wonderful, fantastic beer, for the many. All from a very small space. 192 square feet to be exact. We have packed only the essentials into our brewery. We make every batch by hand and we nurture it every step of the way. Great beer is what we work for, and great beer is what we enjoy.

name: 8 Wired Brewing Company
description:
A microbrewing company based in Marlborough, New Zealand.

To produce mindblowing beers that will wow craftbeer lovers, excite fellow beer geeks and educate the mis-guided who still believe that

name: Alte Ölmühle
description: With the start of the brewery in November 2009, Wittenberge began brewing it's own beer after nearly 20 years. Three beers are produced here and served on tap: a mildly bitter beer, a full-bodied and a special dark beer with a higher Spezialmalzgehalt and stronger hop aroma. All three beers have an original gravity of approximately 12% to 14% and an alcohol content of about 5%. Our brewery consists of a two-vessel brewhouse, which can be seen in the tap room.

name: Asher Brewing Company
description:
At Asher Brewing Company our mission is operate a successful brewery that produces world-class certified organic ales, while utilizing environmentally sustainable and socially responsible business practices. Our brewery is run on 100% wind power!

Chris Asher decided that the Boulder market deserved to have locally brewed organic beers. After nearly a year of planning, research, and hard work building a brewery, Asher Brewing Company opened the doors for business on November 20th, 2009.  

On February 25th, 2010 organic certification was issued for all beers at Asher Brewing Company; making it the first all organic brewery in the state of Colorado. Organic ingredients are better for the consumer, better for the environment, and better for the beer. (Studies have shown that pesticides are detrimental to the shelf-life of beer.)

USDA Organic Brewery

name: Back Forty Beer Company
description:
Back Forty is a micro brewery based out of Gadsden, Alabama. With 2 offerings currently distributed throughout the state, Back Forty is the only Alabama based brewery that can be found anywhere from Muscle Shoals to Mobile.

The name Back Forty Beer Company is basically a reference to the back 40 acres of the farm. Tradionally the "Back 40" of a farm is the most challenging to maintain, but also produces some of the best yields due to the rich content of the earth. Likewise, Alabama was one of the last States in The Union to update it's outdated beer laws (MS is the only one left), and now it's time to reap those yields.

The craft beer market in Alabama has a lot of room to grow, and we plan on doing everything we can to make that happen. Our main goal is to focus on the local community and support other small business owners while offering up our tasty flavors for the people of Alabama. 

The company is founded in Alabama, and just about every aspect of this business is supported by Alabama based suppliers. We've worked with a Design firm out of Athens, AL on our label and logos, our attorney is in Birmingham, our accountant is in Dothan, AL, our shirts are printed in Huntsville and our Brewmaster is out of Montgomery, AL. 

We've been working with Jamie Ray (A nationally recognized Brewmaster who has won several medals at the Great American Beer Festival in Denver, CO), for over a year on our first offering, "Naked Pig Pale Ale". And we have several ideas in the works for additional year round offerings in the coming months. We're looking forward to producing some great beers that Alabamian's have never tasted before. Once things get up and running, we'll start releasing some seasonal offerings, one-time offerings, limited edition batches, etc. That's what we're really excited about.

The only aspect of this operation that isn't planted firmly in Alabama soil, is the production and packaging. We had to go to another craft brewery in a neighboring state for our first production batches. This is partially due to the enormous start-up costs associated with building a complete brewery operation from scratch. But it's also given us the opportunity to support another regional micro-brewery while we get up and running.

name: Backlash Beer Company
description:
It’s time to stand up against the predictable, old beer establishment and craft beers the way they were intended: flavorful, gimmick free and not produced in ridiculous quantities. We’re a Boston company with a Boston attitude, here to reclaim beer by recruiting people to fuel the craft beer movement.

Join the Backlash.

name: Barrier Brewing Company
description:
Barrier Brewing Co. is a 1bbl brewery operated by Evan Klein and Craig Frymark located in Oceanside, NY. The focus is small scale production of a breadth of styles and flavors brewed for the local market. The first batches were released to the public in June 2010.

"Brewing For Quality Not Quantity"

name: Battered Boar Brewing Company
description: Little Brewery, Big Beer

name: Bayou Teche Brewery
description: Bayou Teche Brewing was founded on this simple dream – to craft beers that compliment the cuisine and lifestyle of Cajuns and Creoles.

name: Big Bay Brewing Company
description:
At Big Bay Brewing we believe that life on the water is a little sweeter. And that sweet life is infused in every beverage we create. To us, life on the water means creating and savoring memories and moments that are cherished for a lifetime. And what better way to enhance those memories and moments than with the right beverage to sip and savor. 

The founders of Big Bay have a strong fundamental belief that craft brewed beverages and life on the water go hand in hand. Alone, what we drink is just sustenance, but paired with the right sights, sounds and settings, it becomes part of a much larger experience. And we are dedicated to bringing the “experience” back to brewing. After all, our personal life experiences have played a leading role in developing Big Bay Brewing. And as we grow, we invite you to be a part of Big Bay by sharing your experiences with us. In other words, we want you to be a part of the sweet life with us.

name: Big Muddy Brewing Co
description:
All over the United States, craft breweries are continuing an American tradition which experienced an almost 50 year drought after the repeal of prohibition. Big Muddy Brewing in Murphysboro, Illinois is much like many of these new “microbreweries” all over the country, reinvigorating an industry and continuing a heritage that has skipped several generations.
Until 1940, Murphysboro was the home of a thriving brewery and until prohibition; it was one of the cornerstones of the town’s industry. In 1910, the Stecher Brewing Company produced more than 40,000 barrels of beer a year. However, passage of the Volstead Act in 1919, which ushered in the era of prohibition, began a slow decline to the brewery’s demise.
Big Muddy Brewing’s founder Chuck Stuhrenberg attended Southern Illinois University Carbondale in the 1980s. After graduation, he opened a franchise of Chicago’s Rosati’s Pizza in Carbondale and in 1990, began another venture, Spray Shield Industries.
It was while Stuhrenberg was in college at SIU that he began making his own beer.
Stuhrenberg and his college buddies would homebrew, and as the years went on, he began to take his hobby more seriously.
Stuhrenberg always had professional brewing in the back of his mind, but it stayed a hobby until 2009. In July, 2009, Big Muddy Brewing finally began production, the first brewery in Murphysboro in over 50 years.
The first beer offered by Big Muddy Brewing is Kinkaid Wheat. It was a recipe popular with Stuhrenberg’s family and friends. It was also something he felt would be a good “craft beer transition brew” for those used to the conventional corporate brew (BMC).
Kinkaid Wheat is currently offered on tap and by bottle in bars, restaurants and liquor stores across Southern Illinois alongside of Big Muddy Brewing’s second selection, “Saluki Dunkel Dog”, a dark, amber/dunkel style beer.
The third and newest addition to Big Muddy Brewing’s lineup is an ale called “Big Muddy Pale Ale”, and future varieties include “Logan’s Lager”.

name: Big Shoulders Beer Company
description:
It started with a love of beer and a homebrewing kit.

Big Shoulders isn't a big beer company (yet). Hopefully soon we will win a ton of awards, but for right now, we strive to make good beer that everyone can enjoy, no matter where they fall on the beer lover's spectrum.

Our first releases will be Crosstown Wheat and Hopapalooza. Crosstown Wheat is a perfect summer wheat ale brewed with lemongrass and coriander. Hopapalooza is an IPA with nicely balanced aromatic and bittering hops.Both will be available in bottles and kegs in April 2012.

name: Big Wood Brewery
description: Brewed in Vadnais Heights, MN, Big Wood Brewery is a licensed production brewery that produces distinctive craft brews for distribution throughout MN. Touting its edgy yet playful brand image and unforgettable name among its most distinguishing factors, Big Wood Brewery recognizes that, to stand out in Minnesota, consumers need to be torn away from normalcy. Ambiguity runs rampant among dozens of area breweries, yielding an opportunity for a bold new player to gain notoriety for its brand and its brews.

name: Birrificio Rurale
description:
Il Birrificio Rurale nasce nel 2009 dall'idea di cinque appassionati birrofili che hanno voluto ritrovare le origini agricole della birra in un territorio a forte vocazione rurale.
​Per questa ragione il Birrificio vede la luce ospite di una realtà agricola, valorizzando quella struttura che un tempo immagazzinava il raccolto annuale: il silos.

name: Black Heart Brewery
description: Black Heart Brewery are producers of exceptional hand-crafed beers. From our signature Weizen with it's polarising taste, to our Dunkelweizen with it's light and dark complexity, these aren't your average beers.

name: Black Market Brewing Company
description:
Black Market produces high-quality, handcrafted beer.

HUMBLE BEGINNINGS. ALWAYS GREAT BEER.
A small budget, tight resources, and big goals are what Our first brews were made out of at a small warehouse that was, more realistically, a large garage. On that small 1 bbl brewing system we pinned our dreams and created the much-loved Hefeweizen.

FINEST QUALITY INGREDIENTS, FRESHEST QUALITY RESULTS
With big dreams for a mircobrewery, Black Market opened to put Temecula, California on the map with a commitment to use only the best malt, hops and yeast­, all selected by hand to ensure quality.  The results were award-winning products with a reputation for craft excellence.

GREAT BEER FROM WINE COUNTRY
As one of Temecula’s first craft breweries, Black Market introduced locally brewed beers to the community. Now found far beyond Temecula, Black Market beers are on shelves and in establishments throughout Southern California, Arizona and Washington.

LEADING A MOVEMENT
Like many craft breweries before us, we have followed stories of those who came before us. We’re proud to have launched the movement in Temecula, to keep inspiring the next waves of great beer with our success, and to continue to lead through our quality process, experimental hop releases, and innovative beers.

name: Black Raven Brewing Company
description: The Black Raven is a true neighborhood brewery with a small retail taproom. We are the Eastside’s home to world-class, small-batch brewed ales & lagers. We also feature a continually changing hand-picked selection of other notable Washington State beers. And most importantly, home to local beer lovers who want to be a part of a community that enjoys great beer and great friends.

name: Black Shirt Brewing Company
description: An artisanal brewing company that combines classic and timeless technique coupled with progressive innovation and unwavering commitment to quality to create the very pinnacle of beer. Our hand-crafted, hand-bottled beer will be available in fine restaurants and select retail establishments soon.

name: Blue Heron Brewing Company
description: From Pale Ale to Stout and from Porter to Pilsner, brewing beer  is our passion and as a family we're dedicated to bringing  New Mexico the finest brews.

name: Boon Island Ales
description:
Boon Island Ale is a gathering place where the Maine Microbrews are ice cold and fresh. Our Brewer, Don Chandler (of Oak Pond Brewery) has crafted some of the finest ale you will ever taste. All of the BIA featured ales are brewed in Skowhegan Maine. They are from grain. No priming sugars are added.

The featured NUTBROWN ALE uses 8 different malts, toasted and coffee like tones. Imported English hops provide a full a pleasant hop profile.

The BIA featured INDIA PALE ALE is a medium bodied ale with a smooth spicy hop flavor; finishes with a fine hop aroma.

The BIA featured LAGER is a smooth dry pils in the German tradition. With a longer brew time and a temperature controlled environment. This golden pilsner provides a crisp, refreshing flavor with a creamy dense head.

The BIA featured LIGHT is light, crisp ale with a smooth, clean finish - light hopping with a hint of wheat malt blend, in a mellow brew with a creamy white head.

name: Boylan Bridge Brewpub
description:
The Boylan Bridge Brewpub has a bright and open atmosphere conducive to conversation, business, and social interaction. The architectural millwork and cabinetwork built downstairs in the shop has made the Bridge a beautiful, durable facility using fine woods, ceramic tile, and canvas covered tackboard on the walls.

The brewing operation is visible from the bar through glass doors, offering an industrial connection with stainless steel tanks and copper piping throughout.

The most popular feature of the place is the outdoor deck. It offers an expansive view of the downtown Raleigh skyline. A wood post and beam pergola structure enclose the space and provides mottled shade without trapping sound, making conversation easy.

name: Brauerei Luzern
description: We brew on a modern, fully automated system. The brewing equipment is it designed to produce the highest quality wort with low energy consumption. On a tour of the brewery we can give you insight into the working processes of our brewery.

name: Brenner Brewing Company
description:
Brenner Brewing Co. is a microbrewery in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Founder, Mike Brenner was awarded the title Master Brewer after completing a rigorous international training program at the Siebel Institute and the Doemens Akademie.

Brenner's passion for crafting delicious beer and his lifelong devotion to Milwaukee's arts and music scene, has led to the creation of Brenner Brewing's "12 Ounce Ambassadors." Each style of beer features the artwork of a local artist and comes with a soundtrack featuring the music of local bands. As Brenner Brewing's distribution expands so does the awareness of Milwaukee's incredible arts scene.

Brenner also opened a 25,000 sq ft arts incubator in the building with the brewery which features a 2,000 sq ft contemporary art gallery and 20 artists' studio spaces. Come visit the brewery, tasting room, and art gallery soon.

name: Brouwerij Maenhout
description: Small artisinal brewery in the center of west flanders

name: Cathedral Square Brewery
description: Founded in March 2009, Cathedral Square Brewery is located at 3914 Lindell Blvd in Mid-Town St. Louis. With over 200 accounts in Missouri, Illinois, and Kansas, we offer our beers in both draught and 22oz. bottles. Head brewmaster Brian Neville has over 15 years of experience in the industry. Brian has been with the likes of Spanish Peaks Brewing and their flagship Black Dog Brewery. Brian also helped build O'Fallon Brewery & Trailhead Brewery among others.

name: Cervecería Calavera
description:
En Cervecería Calavera cada cerveza es única, hecha para consentir y deleitar,diseñada para quien busca nuevas experiencias, sabores y texturas.
Cervecería Calavera es un laboratorio de sabores donde exploramos nuevas dimensiones gustativas. En búsqueda de la perfección cervecera, muchas veces rompemos con los cánones establecidos, otras veces nos inclinamos hacia los más de 80 estilos tradicionales de cervezas, pero siempre trabajamos con las raíces solidamente plantadas en la calidad verdadera, tangible, simple y directa en todo lo que hacemos.

En Cervecería Calavera todas nuestras cervezas son de autor, siendo éstas expresión del gusto personal del Maestro Cervecero, quien le da a todas sus recetas un toque personal, un estilo propio. Su autoría no se expresa en letras y obras de arte sino en sabores, aromas y texturas, diseñando experiencias gustativas que buscan despertar un recuerdo, una idea, un pensamiento.

Cuide su Calavera, si maneja mejor tome malteza de Calavera.

name: Chicago Beer Company
description: Chicago Beer Company is in persistent pursuit of producing the finest quality craft beers that will be deemed worthy of their Chicago namesake. Such was the destiny that led to the creation of Chicago Beer Company’s flagship release, Chi-Town Windy City Wheat! On draft and in bottles!

name: Clown Shoes Beer
description:
Founded in December 2009 by beer lovers trying to make work fun again, Clown Shoes has been redefining what craft beer should be. We strive to add our own little creative twists on under-represented styles and styles in need of change.

Our mission now is to produce beer without pretension while being free and a little crazy.

name: Colorado Brewing Company
description: New Brewhouse/Micro-Brewery in downtown Boulder, CO. What was the Redfish Brewhouse location, the Colorado Brewing Company/Boulder Draft House opened its doors February 20, 2009. We are a Boulder brewhouse serving amazing comfort food that is regionally and globally inspired along with perfectly balanced handcrafted beers for the everyday beer drinker and the micro-brew enthusiast, all served in a friendly and comfortable setting that is enhanced by quality live music several days a week

name: Cool Springs Brewery
description: Brewpub with a focus on innovation and unique brewing styles. We utilize multiple yeast strains and techniques to develop traditional sours, and Belgian style beer. We also love the hops, and most of CSB's pales represents a PNW hop characteristic.

name: Craggie Brewing Company
description: Our passion is to locally produce quality craft beers and to foster community involvement with commitment and integrity.

name: Croocked Moon
description:
The name Croocked Moon is inspired by a graffiti drawing, I once saw a grinning moon. Its expression captured in many ways the philosophy I want to resist. This is also underlined by the name of the election. I want to create a brand with an attitude that is not afraid to push the limits and the current perception of what the actual individual beers represent. English ologists will notice the spelling error in the word "Croocked". This misspelling is because originally, that I was given webdomænet and because of a typo there had sneaked an extra "c" in. I wondered whether I should buy another domain name, but then decided that it actually fell very much in line with my philosophy about challenging the conventional way of perceiving the beers on: I want to signal a more aggressive and provocative attitude towards the conventional way put together on the beer.

The slogan "Ergo Bibendum", which loosely translated means "why we drink" is the old character and is used increasingly often by medical students when they are toast. The idea behind this slogan is simple. As a philosophy describes, I want to create beers that challenge and provoke, but simultaneously has a flavor that gives people reason to choose just one Croocked Moon when they want a beer, there is something beyond the usual. 
Croocked Moon must in itself be an excellent reason to drink a beer (or two).

name: DC Brau Brewing Company
description: The fact that D.C. has become a world-class beer town is undeniable. The choices available to the local beer nerdery are staggering and ever expanding. The neighborhood corner stores continue to add microbrews to their stock and it seems that a dynamite draft selection is essential to any new bar that opens. Restaurants regularly hold beer dinners featuring multi-course food and beer pairings and for seven days in the spring, during DC Beer Week, the number of beer-themed events can make the head spin. At a handful of downtown brewpubs the beer enthusiast can sample a variety of house made brews. What D.C. has not had in over 60 years, however, is a brewery whose product is available in local stores and on tap outside of its site of production.

name: Doubleheart Brewing
description: Doubleheart evokes the love of all things that come in pairs in our life, Tara and I, our two dogs Jake and Shay and our love of both Chicago and Harbor Springs. Doubleheart’s beers are a reflection of these dualities.

name: Draai Laag Brewing Company
description:
Traditionally, all goods were made or sold locally.  Butchers, bakers, farmers and even brewers, made their products for local consumption.

Founded in 2009, Draai Laag began as a way to introduce beer with creative flavors into the market, offering a bit of variety in a world of Pilsners, Pales Ales and Porters.

Here at Draai Laag we use old world methods, such as bottle conditioning by aging our ales on lees.  We brew in small batches and use several strains of yeast to produce our beers.   The drinker may notice slight nuances from batch to batch.  But, you will find that all our ales are aged and, just like a fine wine, can be laid down for extended periods.   This results in a unique drinking experience each time a bottle is opened.

Here at Draai Laag we like to cater to those that want something respectful of tradition, but ultimately different.  Those who are not satisfied drinking the norm.  Most importantly, we get our biggest enjoyment and fulfillment not from profit, but from your smile after the first sip.

This company was built on the dream of doing what we love and following our passion.  For those who understand us, we thank you and hope you enjoy what we have to contribute.

name: Eddyline Restaurant and Brewing Company
description:
Eddyline Brewery has been brewing in the heart of Collegiate Peaks in Buena Vista, Colorado since 2009.

All beer are brewed with inspiration from our wild surroundings. Crank Yanker IPA is the best beer for cruising single track all over the valley. River Runners Pale Ale is the greatest all day suds sipper on the river and beyond. Come visit and have a great time in the Colorado Wilderness!

name: Ekim Brewing Co
description: A small craft brewing company based in Sydney’s Northern Beaches. We are a small microbrewery, producing quality, handcrafted beers since 2009.

name: Elk Mountain Brewing
description: Elk Mountain Brewing, Inc., established in April of 2009, is owned and operated by Tom and Marcia Bell. Elk Mountain Brewing is a small scale microbrewery located in the industrial area of Parker, Co, serving truly unique handcrafted microbrews with award winning recipes. Tom Bell is the head brewer with nearly 20 years of experience. Although he brews a variety of beers, his specialty is German beers with a twist. For those non-drinkers we will have homemade Root Beer on tap.

name: Evolution Craft Brewing Company
description: Our mission is to produce the finest local ales in the Mid Atlantic Region. We are a Craft Brewing company focused on producing well balanced handcrafted ales.

name: Fathom & League Hop Yard Brewery
description: Fathom & League Hop Yard Brewery is dedicated to the first brewers in the Pacific Northwest.  On May 5, 1792, the intrepid crew of the HMS Discovery rowed ashore about 5 miles from our brewery.  They brewed a spruce tip beer and enjoyed a day off from their exploration of the Strait of Juan de Fuca and Salish Sea.  We are proud to carry on the tradition of brewing beer in this remarkable corner of the world. Cheers!

name: Figure Eight Brewing
description:
Figure Eight Brewing is a small craft brewery located just an hour southeast of Chicago in Valparaiso, Indiana. We believe in making great beer and enjoying life to its fullest.

Our mission is to make great beer and share it. Utilizing the best ingredients while synthesizing classic and innovative brewing styles and techniques, riding on the edge of where beer has gone and where beer is going.

name: Finger Lakes Beer Company
description:
Finger Lakes Beer Company was established in the fall of 2009 by Partners, Wayne Peworchik & Mark Goodwin. Both Wayne and Mark were avid homebrewers for many years. Mark continued on with his brewing education by completing the Web-based Concise Course in Brewing Technology at the Siebel Institute of Technology World Brewing Acadamy from which he obtained his Certificate.   We selected our location nestled in the heart of the beautiful Finger Lakes Region of upstate New York for its close proximity to Keuka Lake and the availability for lake water for brewing. Our building offered a spacious workable layout, ample parking and room for future expansion. We began our building renovations and equipment installation in early 2010,  received our license in the fall of 2010, and on November 11th, 2010 opened our doors for tours, tastings, and growler fills. 

Our Brew Room features a matched Ripley 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Brewing system. The Brew House includes a Boil Kettle, Mash Tun and Hot Liquor Tank. The Brew Room also features 3 double wall digital temperature controlled fermentation tanks, grain mill, filter, and other assorted brewing equipment. Adjacent to the brew room is a walk-in cooler containing 8 - 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Serving Tanks and assorted keg filling and dispensing equipment. 

The entrance way and tasting room offer large windows for great views of the Brew Room  as well as a large comfortable area for you and your friends to relax and visit while enjoying your favorite brews offered fresh daily. We offer tastings and growler fills of fine crafted ales and root beer all brewed on premises as well as guided tours on non-brewing days. Have your own growlers, we fill your clean growlers. Don't own one yet, no worries we have 1 and 2 liter in several styles with our logo on them.

name: Fire Island Beer Company
description: Fire Island Beer Company has emerged from the handiwork of two brothers and a cousin who developed their taste for craft beer and home brewing during the summers they spent on Fire Island, the naturally beautiful barrier island just off Long Island's south shore. The relaxed island has attracted families, artists, partiers, weekend beach-goers and outdoor sports lovers for generations, yet it refuses to allow cars, pretention and the frantic pace common to NY-metro area culture. This led us to coin it “The Other New York”, a concept we find very refreshing.

name: Freetail Brewing Company
description:
#1 rated brewpub in Texas (rated by BeerAdvocate.com) located at NW Military Highway and Loop 1604. Winner of the San Antonio Express-News 2009 Critics Choice and 2010 Silver Medalist for "Best Place for a Cold Beer" & San Antonio Magazine's Best of the City "Best Place for a Beer" for two years running (2009, 2010).  Winner of Draft Magazine "Top 25 Beers of 2010" in the smoked beer category for "Rubio Fumando".

Named after the official Texas flying mammal, the Mexican Free-tail Bat, Freetail opened its doors Thanksgiving Weekend 2008 and has been cranking out highly rated, fresh, off-the-wall brews ever since.

We feature fresh craft brews from in house and around the state of Texas in addition to artisan pizzas, sandwiches, salads, appetizers and desserts made from the highest quality ingredients.

Join the friendliest staff in town for happy hour M 4-7 andW-F 3-7 with $5 apps and $1 off beer and wine!  Or try us on Tuesdays for Pint Night where Freetail pints are $2.50 all day, or Mondays for $10 pitchers.  Enjoy Freetail brews and guest beer from microbreweries around the state in our spacious open seating, or large outdoor patio with bar service, and catch the game on one of our nine high-definition TV's and two 100"+ screens.free_wi_fi_spot_copy.gif  Free WiFi for customers.

name: Fulton Brewing Company
description: The Fulton Brewing Company is a local craft brewery located in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Brewing professionally since 2009 (and out of a garage since 2006), this small team of brewers have created a line of beers that has been in high demand among bars and pubs in the Minneapolis/St. Paul area. Since moving to a new location in 2011, the Fulton Brewery is the only production brewery operating in Downtown Minneapolis. A taproom at the brewery is currently under construction with a planned opening in March 2012.

name: Funkwerks
description:
In 2007 Gordon Schuck’s recipe design and brewing skills resulted in a gold medal-winning Saison at the National Homebrew Competition. Brad Lincoln first experienced craft beer while working as an accountant in Portland, OR. The two met during the winter of 2009 while attending the Siebel Institute and studying brewing science. After being immersed in beer for the better part of five months, the two graduated and shared a desire to open a brewery. This resulted in the Saison-focused brewery that is now Funkwerks, opening December 9, 2010.
 
Saisons originated as Belgian farmhouse ales- brewed during winter months for the farm workers during the summer months. Usually having a dry profile and complex fruity aromas, Saisons today are brewed year-round and generally have a higher alcohol percentage than their original versions.
 
Funkwerks’ two flagship beers, Saison and Tropic King, are produced year round. Also brewed annually are four seasonals, a number of small experimental batches, and select barrel-aged releases. Funkwerks flagship Saison was awarded a gold medal at the 2012 Great American Beer Festival (GABF) and a silver medal in 2011. Deceit, a Belgian-Style golden strong ale, was also awarded a gold medal at the GABF in 2012. In addition to receiving two gold medals in 2012, the GABF named Funkwerks the 2012 Small Brewing Company of the Year.
 
Funkwerks is located at 1900 East Lincoln Avenue in Fort Collins, Colorado. The tasting room- complete with an indoor bar, retail area and spacious outdoor, dog-friendly patio- is open 7 days a week: Sunday through Thursday from 12pm-8pm; Friday and Saturday from 12pm-9pm. Brewery tours are given Saturdays at 2pm.
 
Funkwerks is currently distributed in:
Colorado:
American Eagle Distributing and C.R. Goodman
 
Nebraska:
Quality Brands of Omaha and Double Eagle Beverage
 
Arizona:
Hensley Beverage Company

name: Galway Bay Brewery
description:
When it comes to enjoying beer, we like full on flavour.

That’s why we hand-craft our beers in small batches using carefully selected hops to make a punchy, tasty brew.

We have just opened our new brewery which will give us better consistency across batches. They don’t call it craft for nothing! Our new brewery has a greater capacity too, which means more delicious beers for everyone! Vive la revolution!

Try our beers at any of our eight bars in Galway and Dublin. You’ll never go back to mass market beer again.

name: Golden Ticket Brewing
description: Golden Ticket Brewing were Nathan Crabbe and Ally McGilvray. In the winter of 2009 they decided to enter the New Zealand brewing world with a desire to brew the best and most seasonally appropriate beers they could manage. Brewing with the team at Invercargill Brewery their debut beer is expected in New Zealands best bars and pubs in the Spring of 2009. After Nathan moved on to new pastures Ally decided to keep the dream alive and continued brewing as Golden Ticket Brewing.

name: Great Black Swamp Brewing Company
description:
Great Black Swamp Brewing Company is Toledo Ohio's newest Microbrewery. This site will be updated often as we get our full line of draft beers distributed throughout Northwest Ohio wherever you see craft beer on tap. Check back often  to learn more and follow our progress.

If you would like to learn more about getting Great Black Swamp Brewing Company Beer on tap in your establishment we can be reached at Sales@greatblackswampbrewing.com.

name: Great South Bay Brewery
description: GSB is a Craft Brewery in Long Island, NY, Specializing in American, Belgian & German Beers, with much added creativity.

name: Greenport Harbor Brewing Company
description:
The idea began a long time ago over … well … a pretty terrible beer.  You see we (John from NY and Rich from Boston) met in college and had to drink what beer we could afford in those days.

As the years went by, the better the beer we consumed, the more we were consumed by it.  We tried every beer imaginable.  We read about beer. We talked about beer. We began making our own beer.  And finally we started talking and dreaming about opening a brewery on the North Fork.

In the Spring of 2008 the dream became a reality when Rich heard about an old firehouse for sale in the Village of Greenport.  Driven by thirst more than brains, we bought the building in the middle of what has been called a Global Economic Meltdown.  Next we started the renovation.  Did we mention Global Economic Meltdown?  We tried to do most of the work ourselves and luckily got a lot of help from some good friends and family. 
The promise of beer can be powerful. Our luck continued when on a snowy January day, with no roof on our brewery, we got a visit from DJ Swanson and his 2 young children. No one in their right mind would have joined us. DJ did and agreed to be our new head brewer. In April with roof replaced, windows installed, and drains dug, our brew house arrived and the idea of making Greenport Harbor beer began. Four months later in July of 2009 we were officially shipping (hand truck and family cars) our beer.

Today our beer is served in over 200 places on Long Island (thank you Justin) and NYC.

We’re proud to say that since summer of 2009 we have been singled out for nearly every beer we have brewed from the Village Voice to the Tasting Table to TimeOut NY to Newsday to NY Examiner to Wall Street Journal to countless beer and food blogs.
We have a total of 13 employees if you include our forklift and delivery truck, which we do. We hope to add to this number in the next few months when we grow by 66 and 2/3’s percent by adding 2 new tanks. We are the only local brewery that brews 100% of our beer. We are small but hungry…we mean thirsty.

name: Hermitage Brewing Company
description: Hermitage Brewing Company (HBC) is a Silicon Valley native.  In the few years HBC has been distributing, we have won multiple awards and accolades for our beer, including Hoptopia, Maltopia, Ale of the Imp, Ale of the 2 Tun, and our Single Hop Series.

name: Highlander Brew Co
description: Highlander Brew Co. is located in South River, in the Almaguin Highlands of Ontario. The brewery is on the Northern edge of Algonquin Park, making Highlander the most northerly craft brewery in Ontario.

name: Home of the Brave Beverage Co
description: Since 1991 Hawaii's Home of the Brave has proudly supported and honored our United States military. Join our continued mission to serve our troops by opening Hawaii's first Brewseum. We want to provide our troops and all Americans with the finest locally crafted beer. With your support, together we can make it a reality. Support America - Support Our Troops - Buy Home of the Brave.

locations.name: The Brewseum
locations.hoursOfOperation: The Brewseum is a brewpub celebrating the history of beer in Hawaii. Enjoy some of the best beers in Honolulu at an incredible one-of-a-kind spot!

name: Hometown Beverages
description:
Hometown Beverages’ mission is to create traditional American lagers with flavors that are unique to the palate of beer drinkers in their respective area. Try new Hometown Light, Pennsylvania Lager, New Jersey Lager and New York Lager!

Hometown Beverages is America’s best new brewer of what they call "specialty" session beers. You know the kind you can drink one after another - after another - and not get filled up. 

Hometown currently brews four different beers, namely - Hometown Light, Hometown Pennsylvania Lager, Hometown New Jersey Lager and Hometown New York Lager. 

Chris Curylo and Bob Selsky, aka The “Hometown Boys,” are the owners of Hometown. They brew their beers in beautiful Wilkes-Barre, PA.

name: Hop City Brewing Co.
description:
For too long beer has been removed from its true craft roots.

Think about the first guys who sat down in some basement to craft the first batch of beer. There were no rules, no reverence, no sales projections to meet. Just ingenuity, passion, and the chutzpah to create something completely different. That was a craft beer, not the $150 million ad campaigns.

At Hop City, we brew beer because we love it. And in doing so we have created a really really really good recipe we dare you to try. Made with the only the best ingredients, this beer will make squirrels bark and grown men cry.

It's time to make some noise.

It's time for craft beer with attitude.

name: Hop Valley Brewing Co.
description:
Founded in February, 2009, Hop Valley is the first craft brewery in Springfield, OR.  With a 15 barrel system and a restaurant that compliments the fine hand crafted beer, Hop Valley has grown into one of Springfield's largest businesses.  Distributing beer throughout the State of Oregon.
Based on that success, and significant pent up demand for their beer, Hop Valley has just opened a new facility at 990 W.1st Ave in Eugene at which they have built a new, much larger, 60 barrel production brewery.  This facility will be capable of producing up to 100,000 barrels per year, in stark contrast to the system in Springfield, that is maxed out at about 4000 barrels produced in 2012.
Our state of the art equipment and the facility are all built with every opportunity toward a green foot print, including the most efficient lighting, boiler, solar heating, etc.. available today.
The new facility has a large tasting room and outdoor patio and also has limited food service, to allow customers to enjoy all of our craft brews in a very comfortable setting, and with enough parking and outdoor area to support large parties!

name: Horsefly Brewing Co
description:
Horsefly Brewing Company decided they wanted the name to represent something “local”.  They couldn’t spell Uncompahgre so they settled on Horsefly, which is a peak 10,000 feet high on the Uncompahgre Plateau west of Montrose.

In April of ’09 Horsefly Brewing Company started brewing recipes and fine tuning them.  In May ’09 construction began on the current location.  After lots of sweat and tears, (from watching the bar top drip on the floor) and with the help of a lot of friends and family, the doors finally opened September 9th, 2009.   09-09-09 was supposed to be lucky someone said.

In September of ’10 the doors opened at our new & current location. This was a 4 month adventure into remodeling the building to suit as brewery.

name: Huske Hardware House Restaurant and Brewery
description:
Fayetteville North Carolina's only downtown brewery with live entertainment!  Enjoy first-class Custom Brewed beer in a casual, sophisticated atmosphere!

Huske Hardware is proudly brewing 6 unique Custom Craft Beers - never filtered and always using the highest quality import and domestic malts and hops.

name: Inland Empire Brewing Company
description:
Inland Empire Brewing Company was formed in 2007 by three long time friends.  We had all been home brewers for approximately five years prior to stumbling upon a really good deal on some used 7 BBL brewing equipment. We all three decided that we had what it takes to go big, and sell our beer to the public!

After about two years of work with Government agencies, permitting and construction, we opened our doors to the public on February 20th, 2009!  While we are now down to two owners, we continue to grow at a comfortable pace.

We’ve recently (early 2012) added four 15 BBL State of the art conical fermenters, which has improved fermentation times, consistency and quality.  We are also working on other new projects, yet to be announced.

name: Justice Brewing
description:
Established as Justice Brewing, LLC in 2009 I set out to open a small scale craft brewery. Having spent a few years as a homebrewer and always wanting to work for myself I attended Craft Brewing classes at Chemeketa Community College in Salem, OR and read as many books as I could on brewing. I searched for a long time trying to find a suitable place to open up and could be licensed as a Microbrewery. I finally found the location in 2011 and started the move. Then finally in 2012 went through all the legal red tape of opening Everett’s first Belgian Style brewery.

Due to current regulations in the City of Everett we are not open for retail sales. You can make an appointment if you would like a tour or make arrangements for a delivery.

Among other things we now brew AWARD WINNING BEER! Thats right our recipes are now the recipients of not only numerous Blue & Red Ribbons at the 2012 Evergreen State Fair but our “White & Nerdy” Belgian Wit won Best of Show.

name: Kichesippi Beer Company
description:
Kichesippi Beer is a family owned business, brewing in Ottawa, Ontario.

The question we get asked the most is; a Cool name, what does it mean?Kichesippi is a word meaning "The Great River". Prior to 1855, when the City of Ottawa was founded, the Ottawa River was known as the Kichesippi. The river has consistently been an integral part of the history of Ottawa and Eastern Ontario.

We have been involved with the beer industry since 1995 in many different capacities. Working with breweries in Halifax, Toronto and Guelph introduced us to array of beer from around the world. Everything from British Columbia craft beer, to brands from Belgium, Germany and Japan; have fueled our passion for great beer.

name: Kinney Creek Brewery
description: Kinney Creek Brewery started out as a love for beer, and a lack of quality brewed, right priced beer.  After making home brew for a small test group,  things got bigger and bigger.  Now we are making several varieties of beer to accommodate the need for great Midwest Brewed beer.  We source as many of our ingredients that we can from our local neighbors to bring you the very freshest and eco-friendly beer on the market.,   Currently we are expanding our facility, increasing our advertising, expanding our exposure to local bars & restaurants, and introducing our product to new customers.  So please watch for us in your neighborhood.

name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company
description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.

La Blonde, La Grisette, Blind Ambition Abbey Ale, Trois Filles Tripel, and seasonal ales such as La Trappistine® Belgian Dark Ale, Bluebelly Barleywine and Dérailleur® Bière-de-Garde are brewed onsite. Ladyface is one of Los Angeles County’s first modern day microbreweries, and the first brewpub in the Conejo Valley. Visit www.ladyfaceale.com for more information on Ladyface beers, tours and special events.

Try our beer and see what Pure Northern Taste is all about. Cheers!

name: Lavery Brewing Company

Lavery Brewing Company was founded in 2009 by husband and wife Jason & Nicole Lavery. Jason Lynch joined the quest in 2010 to build our own 10 barrel production brewery. Born and raised around Erie, PA, we are all excited to bring something new and dynamic to the local beer culture - Brewing Innovative Ales in Small Batches!

By the way, it's pronounced 'Lav-ry' not 'Lave ry', a soft 'a' in the middle. Similar to 'have', not 'gave', thank you very much.

name: Lone Tree Brewery
description: Lone Tree Brewery: Micro-brewery in Gush Etzion. We produce crafted beers using only natural ingredients. E Mail info@LoneTreeBrewery.com Lone Tree is: John and Susan Levin David and Myriam Shire All are products are "Kosher Mehadrin, Gush Etzion"

name: Lonerider Brewing Company
description:
We opened our doors on January 23rd, 2009 and since then we have been impressed with the enthusiasm of craft beer aficionados we meet daily. The craft brewing industry is booming and you can find a tremendous variety out there. North Carolina has undoubtedly become the Southern State for beer with Asheville reigning supreme and Raleigh/Durham/CH not far behind. We hope you continue to support the variety and encourage new brewers to experiment with and craft new styles for everybody’s pleasure.

"Effect change; don't be an audience. Walk your own path, and instead of thinking outside the box, imagine if there was no box."

name: Maine Beer Company
description:
Maine Beer Company is a very small micro brewery located in Portland, Maine.  We don’t concentrate on any particular style of beer.  We don’t do just  big beers or small beers or light beers or dark beers. 

Our production is limited and our process is slow (our beers are 100% bottle conditioned) but our dedication to brewing really good beer and doing what’s right always comes first.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Noon to 8pm Tuesday-Saturday

name: Manor House Brewing
description:
Historically, beer has been brewed on premise at Manorhouses because it was difficult to transport. This led to a great diversity of beer in both taste and style. Manorhouses brewed to seasons and used beer as both sustenance and social lubricant. Manorhouses and the beer they produced were unique to families and the communities of which they were a part. We will fulfill all those same criteria. 

Manor House Brewing represents an alternative to conventional beer, we are prideful in our local roots and want to inspire pride in our local community. Our beer is an output of a thoughtful creative process and we view what we do as art, not commodity. We experiment with new things, but try to predict the outcome in advance. Every so often, we accidentally stumble upon greatness.

Why do we want to brew beer? To satisfy a longing for the simple pleasures and a simpler time. Happiness, joy, and relaxation is our goal.

How are we different from every other craft brewer? The very same thing that makes us the same. We are creative, innovative and different. We do not feel compelled to brew to style as we may create our own, but when we do brew to style, we do so with passion.

name: Mustang Brewing Company
description: Mustang Brewing Company was created to makes great, easy-drinking, craft beers. Headquartered in Oklahoma City, OK, our award-winning line-up includes Washita Wheat, Sixty-Six, Golden Ale, Thirty-Three, Harvest Lager, and more. For details, please visit www.mustangbrewing.com.

name: Mutiny Brewing Company
description: At this family-run locale nestled in the breathtaking Wallowa Valley on the remote northeastern corner of Oregon’s craft frontier, Mutiny is brewing.  Fueling hikers, rafters, and outdoor enthusiasts 330 miles due east of Portland, Mutiny Brewing Company specializes in beer as it’s meant to be made and as it’s meant to be enjoyed.

name: Neil House Brewery
description:
The Neil House Brewery was started by Patrick Kelleher, who was, at the time, an undergraduate student in Chemistry at The Ohio State University. What started as a hobby turned into a passion, and now the Neil House Brewery is open as a fully-functional Columbus-area microbrewery.

Also, the Neil House is a fully stocked retailer of homebrewing supplies. Whether you are into making beer, wine, mead, cider, soda, or cheese, please check the Homebrew Supply section of our website for prices, and stop into the store.

name: New Jersey Beer Company
description: New Jersey Beer Co. is dedicated to crafting quality beer for all; from the occasional beer drinker to the beer aficionado. We believe that good products come from good people, and strive to do our very best for our community and our customers. We believe we can provide happiness through doing what we love, and that a good beer can make the good times great

name: Noble Ale Works
description:
Noble Ale Works is a microbrewery located in Anaheim, California at the Stadium Plaza Business Park in the Platinum Triangle. We are conveniently located between the Angels Stadium and the Honda Center.
 
Our goal is to create and maintain high quality full flavored craft brews for those who can handle it. "We are not here to convert light or non-beer drinkers; our beer is for people that already appreciate craft beer" We will never skimp on quality or freshness of ingredients, so that we can maintain the high profile flavor of brews that we at Noble care about.

name: North Peak Brewing Company
description: The highest quality ingredients and passion of our head brewers Ron Jeffries and John Walsh help to insure every bottle of North Peak beer is brewed to perfection. Everything we do is designed to create ales of outstanding art and flavor. Every beer is brought to life through labor and love. We strive to create beers to lighten the spirit and soothe the soul.

name: Northshire Brewery
description:
Our company policy mandates that we have the radio on anytime we are working in the brewery. Company policy further states that attending our kids' games are more important than any board meeting. Not to mention our fishing poles are always in the trunk of our cars. 

We are not your traditional business, we're alot more fun than that. Top of the line premium grains, great hops and new school craftsmanship is how we create our beers. We don't conform to traditional recipes, we take it to the next level in all things we do. We keep it fun.


We focus on family, friends and making the best beer we can. We started brewing together 5 years ago as a hobby. Thanks to the encouragement of family and friends who loved our beer Northshire Brewery was born. Here at Northshire Brewery we're just trying to make a living doing what we love, brewing beer.

name: O'Dempsey's
description: O’Dempsey’s *Beer To Die For* is the creation of Atlanta homebrewer  Randy Dempsey.  A passionate beer aficionado Randy began all-grain homebrewing in 1984.  He was always focused on adjusting and perfecting his craft and sharing his creations with friends. In 2009, after much persuading he made the decision to "go pro" and share his beers with the rest of the world. He'll continue perfecting his craft and sharing his new brews with his friends.  You know who they are.  Enjoy.

name: Odin Brewing Company
description:
Odin Brewing embraces the exploratory spirit of the ancient Vikings.  We set sail in December 2009, during the height of a global economic storm, and have quickly become one of the fastest growing breweries in Washington, with our beer is now sacking and pillaging cities throughout Washington and British Columbia. We have taken a different tack than many new brewers, and rather than going for a number of very big, single batch beers, we are focused on food-friendly beers in a smaller lineup that is readily available year round. We realized a long time ago that food-friendly by no means needs to be less flavorful, and we actually add ingredients to widen the palate of our beers above and beyond their original styles.

To better integrate with a meal and make our beers more ‘sessionable’ in general, we utilize highly attenuating yeasts to dry out our beers to make them less sweet and filling, then replace that desired sweetness with an addition outside the norm, such as Juniper, Ginger or even Angelica. These ingredients are always kept at a level to avoid building a ‘spice beer’, and always present themselves as a unique and complementary addition. We also focus on extremely clean finishes, and use the entire recipe to build bittering rather than just using the hops to reduce lingering starchiness.

In the end, the true beauty of any flavor is in the eye (and mouth) of the beholder. Read about our beers here, then taste them at your local restaurant or store and judge for yourself if we have truly crafted ‘Great Beer Designed With Great Food In Mind’. We believe we have.

name: Original Gravity Brewing Company
description: Original Gravity Brewing Company is well worth the trip to Milan! This brewpub features unique handcrafted beers and pub sandwiches and snacks. Great atmosphere with an outdoor beer garden in the warmer months. See website for featured small batch beers.

name: OysterHouse Brewing Company
description: The Oyster House is a small micro brewery devoted to producing high quality, unique ales for beer and seafood lovers.

name: Parish Brewing Company
description:
Parish Brewing Co. is a nanobrewery (yes, nano! smaller than micro!) in Lafayette, Louisiana.  We supply Louisiana with uncompromising, craft brewed beer (or biere in our native cajun french).  Using only the finest ingredients, we'd never cut costs at the expense of flavor. 

Think of Parish as an upstart local brewery in cajun country doing battle against boring, tasteless swill.

name: Payette Brewing Co
description:
Our brewery currently runs a 15-barrel brewing system and offers four year-round beers: Payette Pale Ale, Outlaw IPA, Mutton Buster Brown Ale and North Fork Lager. In 2012, we made Idaho brewing history when we introduced Payette Pale Ale and Mutton Buster in cans. Be on the lookout for even more choices of canned beer in the future. In the meantime, you can find our beer in bars, restaurants, and retail locations including grocery and specialty stores throughout Idaho.

We chose the name Payette because it fits the way we live and work. Francois Payette was a French Canadian trapper whose name and memory is enshrined among numerous Idaho landmarks. The name has since become synonymous with an adventurous spirit that pervades Idaho's year-round outdoor lifestyle.

name: People's Brewing Company
description: The People's Brewing Company provides high quality hand-crafted beer and education of the craft beer industry to the people of Lafayette and the state of Indiana while providing community leadership with environmentally friendly business practices. We offer a taproom and tours of our facility. Our staff is fully trained on the brewing process, beer styles, and beer production. We encourage our customers to become educated in craft beers and local beer history.

name: Pipeworks Brewing Company
description:
Pipeworks began, as many breweries do, in the stove top kettles and plastic-bucket fermenters of the home brewer. Beejay Oslon and Gerrit Lewis met while working at Chicago's famous West Lakeview Liquors, a haven for beer geeks in search of new and exciting brews from around the world. While working there, the two got to thinking it was time to turn their passion in to a business.

 The first steps in that long journey  took them to a the small town of Lo in the Belgian countryside. It was there that the Pipeworks boys lived and worked with Urbain Coutteau owner and brewer at the De Struise Brewery. While working there the boys honed their craft, learned the ins and outs of running a brewery, and had the opportunity to create their first commercially available beers. The success of these brews fueled their passion and prepared them for the work ahead of them.

 Upon coming back to the States the two began experimenting with pilot batches, formulating a business plan, and developing an image for Pipeworks.

 Now we are ready to bring what we've learned to the craft beer world!

name: Prism Brewing Company
description: Prism Beer Company was started in 2009 by Rob DeMaria, a Philadelphia native who found artistic expression in making beer. Having studied film in his early college years, he always had an eye for seeing things differently. In fact, that creative thinking enabled his career in technology, but his artistic expression was still missing. So one day he decided to try his hand in making his own beer. Of course, he couldn't allow himself to follow the recipe

name: Quaff On! Brewing Company
description:
Quaff: To drink heartily and with gusto!

At Quaff ON! Brewing Company, 'Gusto' is part of everything we do. Our hand-crafted beers reflect our passion for the brewer's art and our commitment to creating beers that excite and delight the quaffer's palette.
Quaff ON! Brewing Company was formed in 2012 in response to the demand for the iconic craft beers we developed at Big Woods Brewing Company, our brewpub located in the heart of Brown County Indiana. Why 'Quaff ON!'? Because from the day Big Woods threw open its doors in 2009, Quaff ON! has been the rallying cry, the toast, and the salutation of our loyal fans.
When Big Woods founders Jeff McCabe, Tim O'Bryan and Ed Ryan decided to create Quaff ON! Brewing Company, they had one Master Brewer in mind to take Busted Knuckle Ale, Hare Trigger IPA, Six Foot Blonde and Timid Virgin Pale to new heights and a larger market. That Brewer is Mark Havens, whose reputation as a talented and committed 'creator of craft beers' is well known. Mark came on board in time to lend a hand in the conversion of our 60 year old bowling alley into the Quaff ON! brewing facility.
Once Mark got the new brewery up and running and our original Big Woods recipes were in production, Mark began introducing new beers, including Yellow Dwarf Wheat, a hopped up wheat that begs to be quaffed and Sadie the Goat Brown Ale, a hearty homage to the substantial beers quaffed by river pirates 2 centuries ago.
Currently Quaff ON!'s beers are distributed all over Indiana. Look for us at your favorite watering hole and in the craft beer section at package stores throughout the state. If Quaff ON! is not served at your favorite place, send us a note and we'll get it in there! If you're travelling our way, stop in and see us in Brown County and visit us in Nashville at Big Woods Village where you can enjoy fine craft beer, great food and the best in local entertainment.

"Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." - William Shakespeare

name: Rivertown Brewing Company
description: Welcome to the Rivertown Brewing Company, We specialize in brewing traditional Handcrafted Lagers and Ales, using only the finest and freshest ingredients available.  use the buttons to the left to find out "What Ales You"!

name: Ruckus Brewing Company
description:
Ruckus Brewing Company brews products of exceptional quality, re-invigorates brands of historical significance, and services a growing craft brew market with products that satisfy the most discerning pallets."

With Ruckus Brewing you’ll find a commitment to produce high-quality, full-flavored beer by applying both European and American brewing processes. Our line of ales, lagers, and IPAs contain a unique blend of whole flower hops, Belgian grains, selects malts, and the finest spices to satisfy the taste buds of even the most inexperienced beer drinkers.

name: ShawneeCraft Brewing Company
description:
True to nature, true to the craft

It's the motto of ShawneeCraft, a summary of our philosophy, and the ideal to which we aspire. We call it the fidelis philosophy.

We’re true to nature because environmental impact is a consideration in every decision we make. We honor the nature of materials that we work with. No shortcuts, no artifice. We’re true to the craft because we honor traditions of workmanship perfected by centuries of well-trained hands.

The Fidelis Philosophy took root in the fertile soil of Shawnee-On-Delaware, Pennsylvania. Our village, bounded by wooded hills on one side and the Delaware River on the other, enjoys a mild and varied climate, plenty of water and sun, abundant plants and wildlife and friendly, talented people. We are captivated by this nature and its possibilities. And our location- less than 100 miles from both New York City and Philadelphia- makes it only natural for us to broadly share the Fidelis Philosophy.

In a world of mass-production, our products are handmade. In a world of homogeneity, our products represent a defiant individuality. In a world without roots, our products embody a tangible sense of place. We aspire to eat what we grow, to drink what we brew, and to build what we use. And we’d like you to experience a taste of this lifestyle yourself- in the form of ShawneeCraft beer.

description: Six Row Brewing Company produces quality ales from the site of the old Falstaff Brewery at 3690 Forest Park Ave., in the Midtown area of St. Louis, near St. Louis University. Our Old Plant No. 1 Pub is open to the public and features our craft brewed beers along with selections from other craft breweries and wineries. Stop by and enjoy a pint soon! Then, take home a growler to enjoy one of St. Louis' finest craft beers till your next visit!

name: Sleepy Dog Brewery
description: Established in 2009, Sleepy Dog Brewery has been brewing hand crafted beer for wholesale distribution throughout the state of Arizona. Our commitment to brewing consistent, quality beer with meticulous attention to detail has helped us consistently grow our distribution every year. Our products can be found throughout the state of Arizona and soon in Southern California. We supply beer to hundreds of bars and restaurants and most all major grocery and retail chains.

name: St. Francis Brewery
description:
Saint Francis Brewery opened in the Spring of 2009 to great popularity and success.

Known for our hand-crafted beers,  Brewmaster Scott Hettig has built upon our foundation of five beers:  Kolsch, Amber Ale, Nut Brown Ale, Weiss and Oatmeal Stout to feature a Bohemian Pilsner, Double Red Ale, Belgian Triple and many more.

These wonderful beers are complimented by the great food Executive Chef Ron Wolf creates.  When you stop in, make sure you try our ribs!  They are made with our signature Oatmeal Stout BBQ Sauce

name: Starrlight Mead
description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

name: Steadfast Beer Company
description:
Steadfast Beer Co. proudly produces delicious, Gluten-Free craft beer! Look for our first offering, Steadfast Sorghum Pale Ale, in the Gluten-Free section of your favorite Capital Region beer stores! If you want your local bar or restaurant to carry our beer, please tell them to email us - we'll take care of the rest!

We are dedicated to producing Gluten-Free beers that are high in quality and full of flavor. Every day, more Americans are switching to craft beer because IT TASTES GOOD! For those folks who follow a Gluten-Free diet by choice or by necessity and still want to experience the taste of craft beer, Steadfast Beer Co. thinks outside the box, while thinking about what's inside the bottle. Creatively-written recipes and attention to detail make Steadfast a Gluten-Free beer that you can trust!

name: Straight to Ale
description:
Located in the historic Lincoln Mills, we are working hard to provide our hometown of Huntsville, Alabama with top quality, full flavored beer in styles ranging from English brown ales to American Imperial IPA’s and everything in between. You can find our beer on draft at many local restaurants and bars. If we’re not already on tap at your favorite hang-out, please ask them why not!

Straight To Ale’s products are distributed throughout our great state of Alabama by our friends at Alabama Beverage.

The Tap Room is open Wednesday through Saturday from 3pm until 8pm.

FREE brewery tours are given on Saturdays at 2PM.  Weekly tour is limited to 20 people and you must be 21 or over. Reservations are required.

name: Tap Room No. 21 Brewing Company
description:
A tribute to “The Noble Experiment”, Tap Room No. 21 embodies an American spirit of perseverance. During the heyday of the Roaring Twenties, corruption was rampant, lawbreakers became icons and speakeasies replaced saloons. As an ode to the repeal of Prohibition, our best kept secret and most cherished contraband is available for you to enjoy among your crew of notorious bootleggers. 

The ban has been lifted -- Drink openly, rest easily, and pay no heed to “speak easy”.

name: The Blind Pig Brewery
description: An English style pub with it's own built-in brewery. Four kinds of beer brewed just a few feet from where it's served. Plus hundreds of local and craft beers on cask, tap or bottle.

name: The Ilkley Brewery Co.
description: Ilkley Brewery was re-established in the town after a gap of nearly 100 years in 2009. We have a clear philosophy - to brew world class beers distinctive in style, flavour and character. When we say we are passionate about beer, we mean REALLY passionate and this is clearly expressed in our award winning range of beers and ales. Our philosophy starts with the raw materials we use, water from The Yorkshire Dales, the finest English malted barley and hops, sourced by our brewer from all over the world. We let those simple ingredients speak for themselves and combine them with skill and patience to brew beers that are balanced, exceptional and just

name: The Olde Mecklenburg Brewery
description: The Olde Mecklenburg Brewery (OMB), located in the heart of south Charlotte, produces premium, all natural beer and delivers it fresh weekly to bars, restaurants and retailers in the region. OMB uses only the finest ingredients available worldwide and employs traditional, intensive brewing methods to transform them into world class beer that’s full-flavored yet amazingly refreshing. Although our methods are more costly, we think you’ll agree the results are worth it. Look for OMB on tap throughout the Charlotte region, in growler bottles at your local retailer or just come straight to the brewery and taste the difference.

name: Triptych Brewing
description: A triptych (trip-tik) is a work of art, divided into three equal parts and built around a common theme. Triptych Brewing is three guys from three different walks of life sharing our passion for great, local beer with YOU. Built upon the traditional ingredients of hops, barley, and water and serving the communities of Champaign, Urbana, and Savoy, Triptych Brewing is dedicated to exploring the art of craft beer with the community.

name: Triton Brewing Company
description:
Operated by its member-managers, Jon W. Lang and David M. Waldman, Triton Brewing Company is a brewery producing high-quality craft beer for distribution in Indiana. 

Triton Brewing Company is a creative outlet in the form of a traditional, community-based production brewery located in the heartland of Indiana. The shareholders, employees, and libations of Triton Brewing Company embody exemplary strength of character, resolute integrity, and consistent quality in all their forms. We are dedicated to increasing a sense of fun and community through the creation of fine traditionally crafted ale and lager.

Beer and other beverages produced at our Indianapolis facility are available for sale throughout Indiana and Central Illinois. A tasting room at the brewery and a second tap room location provide other marketing opportunities.

Triton Brewing Company is the realization of the dream of Mr. Lang and Mr. Waldman that Indiana be a significant contributor to the world beer culture and can produce local beers that Hoosiers can be proud of and can purchase statewide.

name: True South
description:
We are unlike any other venue that we know of. We have our own award winning Brewery and Chef, an Argentinean Restaurant + a contemporary function space with floor to ceiling views of Port Phillip Bay. 

We like the words generous and uncomplicated. We like the fact that we are in a location that is across the road from the beach and out of the city, but not as far as the peninsula.

We like to say... 'When in doubt head, True South'. We also like questions...so just ask!

name: Two Kilts Brewing Co
description: Two Kilts Brewing Co. was founded in 2009 by owners and brewers Chris Dillon, and Alex McGaw.  Fueled by a passion for all things craft beer they opened a modest 6  barrel brewery and in 2 short years have expanded to their current 15 barrel brewery. They specialize in hand crafting fine American Ales and Lagers, brewed with hints of European influence.

name: Union Ale Brewing Company
description: Union Ale is Santa Barbara's sports bar and ale house. We specialize in Burgers, Flatbreads and Craft Beer. We have Santa Barbara's best onsite beer selections with 24 taps of craft beers from across the nation. We have a bottled beer list that will make you drool. We smoke our meats in house and bake our breads in house. Showing every NFL game, Lakers and Clippers game, and all of your favorite March Madness, Union Ale is the place to be. So come on down and fill up a boot. Cheers.

name: Unity Vibration Living Kombucha Tea
description: Small Artisan Kombucha Manufacturer located in Michigan that began selling in 2009. Has evolved product into a Kombucha Tea that may contain more than 0.5% ABV to keep the integrity, maximum nutrient content, texture, and flavor intact and impeccable. Also selling first pure Kombucha Beer on the market, Triple Goddess, in Raspberry and Ginger that contains 8-9% ABV. Company currently operates out of small micro-brewery in Depot Town, Ypsilanti, Michigan.

name: Von Scheidt Brewing Company
description: VonScheidt Brewing Co. is Twin Falls' home town pub & brewery. Featuring the best live music in the Magic Valley and local beers brewed in house by brewmaster Pat VonScheidt. Delicious food is served daily and we're open till the last cat leaves!

name: White Birch Brewing
description: Founded in 2009, White Birch Brewing has been consistently dedicated to the creation of thoughtful, heartfelt ales for the fun loving beer drinker. Providing beers that range from historical, to contemporary, to the avant-garde, each batch of beer is carefully brewed by hand, and left unfiltered for an exceptional depth of flavor.

name: Wicked Beaver Brewing Company
description:
Wicked Beaver is a West Texas Craft Brewery, formed in Spring of 2009. We are a hands-on Brewery, with no automation to speak of, this keeps us in touch with every batch of beer we brew.
	
On an old dirt road, far from the beaten path, deep in the midst of no-where lives a Wicked Beaver. Why is he Wicked, you may ask? He is Wicked from the ways of the world, so many demands, too many deadlines, minor appreciation, and never enough time. So with little more than the stick in his hand and the Hops in his hanker chief, he journeyed West. Upon arriving in the West he hopped from the tailgate, choked on the dust, and kicked a tumble weed rolling his direction. This is the West, the place full of opportunity “he asked himself” and sighed but after a few Wicked Cold months, the landscape began to change, grass became lush green, trees bloomed and the flowers opened. The Wicked Beaver found the warm days, and cool nights were perfect to pursue his passion.

The Wicked Beaver and his brewing partners have been Brewing Craft Specialty Beer’s in secret for years, perfecting the fragrant aroma by blending only best hops and hand selecting the Malted Barley for the most unique varieties of flavors and textures. The Wicked Beaver is ready to share his unique creations with you!

name: Wiley Brewing Company
description: Wiley Brewing Company is a "Genius" entrepreneurial brewery in the early stages of development. Specialities include "Estate" and "Big" brews for the courageous beer drinker.

name: Wiley Roots Brewing Company
description: Wiley Roots Brewing Company is a small, artisan craft brewery that opened in Greeley, Colorado in June of 2013.
